title: Those Abysal changes seem a bit uh, harsh
body:
https://i.imgur.com/0Rf4hct.jpg

Live Radius: 700 units
PBE Radius: 6 centiunits

Don't get me wrong, it shouldn't be larger than the entire roster's auto range, but the changes going on now make it impossible for any non-vanguard, non-diver to use it. Unless you have the ability to cc opponents for 17 millennia and stand near them, this tiny aura does nothing.

{{champion:78}} {{champion:201}} {{champion:44}}{{champion:223}} {{champion:20}}  get hit especially hard, having the weakest engages of any tanks.

Maybe make it so we don't have to be touching dicks with the enemy Nasus to open him up to damage?

The problem i have is that even on champs like vanguards and tanks, ittd still be horrible because they have abilities that outrange said item, giving it a mediocre affect.

It increases the damage by 15% now instead of 10%.
So for example, if Amumu engages with Q, then it will deal less damage, but his W, E, and R will deal more damage. 

More than compensated.

For someone like amumu, sure. But for other champs who want resists and abilities to do damage at range without the need to engage, not gunna be that great.

Even for cho gath, he doesnt always wanna stand ontop of someone. He wants to often just max range Q and W. Meaning only his E will get a buff from it (R is true damage)
I really think a 300/5-600 for melee range differential would make sense.  Lets it be at around the range of nauts AOE, and covers maos smash fully.

Braum, Taric, Kench, and Nunu are not engage tanks. Taric, Braum, and Kench are Wardens, who focus on defending allies and providing support. They are beefy because they're intended to swoop into the fight and save allies while not dying. Their purpose is not to engage team fights because they don't typically have enough adequate disruption like real engage tanks such as Thresh, Leona, or Nautilus. They shouldn't be building Abyssal Mask to begin with, as there are other MR options they should be building instead like Locket of the Iron Solari, Banner of Command, or Zz'Rot Portal. Nunu is just weird, he's not really an engage tank or a warden, he's just Nunu.

Poppy actually is an engage tank, and  will not have trouble with this. Poppy's engage lunges her into combat, so she will have no difficulty getting to where she needs to be to let the Mask do its thing.

Hmm... I thought one of the purposes of {{item:3001}} was as a supportive item to help supports provide utility to the APC so that supports can help more than just the ADC on the team...  It seems like it should definitely be viable on supportive wardens in that case.

APCs probably shouldn't be building it, but maybe what they actually need is harder scaling multiplicative AP itemization so that the mere 10% bonus from {{item:3001}} doesn't feel worth the item slot for a true APC.  Maybe {{item:3001}} deserves some minor nerfs as well - perhaps its aura could fade-out with distance, increasing magic damage by 1% at the current maximum aura range and scaling to 10% at the new PBE range as an aura "epicenter".  This nerf will mess up my AP support {{champion:35}} build that I play for fun, but I am trying to view this change with an unbiased perspective.

Edit: I posted another alternative idea on this new thread:
https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/WeAU7rqO-abyssal-mask-pbe-nerf-alternative
[Recreated the thread to add a poll.]

Its not meant for supports, it costs 2900 gold.  Support items cost ~2200-2600 gold at most.  Abyssal was meant for tanks who wanted MR while also offering increased damage to their team.  That was always the case, even back when it was abyssal staff, but it has always been used by DPS mages like Ryze and Cass when it had a larger AoE because it allowed them to have MR and safety in lane while also increasing their damage

which is why Riot reduced the AoE.  They said they wanted tanks to use it more instead of being a first buy for battle mages

By the way, I don't even see {{item:3001}} listed as most popular or highest winrate build for very many champions, so I am kind of wondering if the current "abuse" cases are exaggerated.  It's on {{champion:69}}'s most popular build but not her highest winrate build.  It's listed on neither for {{champion:13}}.  It's not listed for {{champion:136}} either, who is another champion claimed to abuse it.  According to the actual data available, it looks like a very rare niche item for non-tanks.  I am honestly not convinced it needs any nerfs.

It's a decently expensive item, but supports have a little bit more gold nowadays and don't need to spend their whole income on sight wards so the days of severely gold-deprived supports are slowly but surely fading away.

According to champion.gg, some supports have their best winrate builds with items that are fairly pricy and aren't support-exclusive, like:
{{item:3003}} {{item:3165}} {{item:3083}} {{item:3194}} {{item:3512}} {{item:3075}} {{item:3143}} {{item:3065}} 

And then you have "supports" ({{champion:63}} {{champion:143}} {{champion:161}} and other mages) building straight standard APC items with a {{item:3092}} thrown in.

I think there is room in the current game for supports to sometimes pick up {{item:3001}} and that it's a good thing, especially if Riot wants to encourage bot-lane APC with support combos in the near future.  In any case, I think it's good if supportive classes, whether they are technically in the support role or are playing a top/jg tank, can itemize to help their APCs.

Her entire kit is basically geared for protecting the backline, not engaging.
